message:
"The detectives working on some of the most high-profile arrests are from the New Jersey State Police Digital Technology Investigations Unit in Hamilton, Mercer County.
State Police Detective Sgt. Paul Sciortino has been working to catch online predators for six years and estimates that the number of conversations he’s engaged in with adults is “in the thousands.”
Traffickers use the same tactics to lure victims. They spend time in the same places as their victims, from online to public places.

data.description: It takes special training -- and a mental toughness -- to impersonate children or child traffickers in these online stings, investigators say
data.title: These 13 men are charged with luring kids for sex - but were actually chatting with cops
